greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f.: Sum_{j>=0} 4^j * (exp(j*x) - 1)^j.
comment: In general, if k > 0 and e.g.f.: Sum_{j>=0} k^j * (exp(j*x) - 1)^j, then a(n) ~ c * (1 + k*exp(1/r))^n * r^(2*n) * n!^2 / sqrt(n), where r is the root of the equation exp(1/r) * (1 + 1/(r*LambertW(-exp(-1/r)/r))) = -1/k and c is a constant (dependent only on k).
mathematica: Flatten[{1, Table[Sum[4^j * j^n * j! * StirlingS2[n, j], {j, 0, n}], {n, 1, 20}]}]
nmax = 20; CoefficientList[Series[1 + Sum[4^j*(Exp[j*x] - 1)^j, {j, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] * Range[0, nmax]!
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 08 2020
